results.title: Good things come in small packages
results.creator_credit: Leeanne Hill, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: When Sam came up to Leeanne Hill and asked her for a hug, a friendship started that has only become stronger over the years. These best friends are there for each other through everything, including Hill’s struggle with Turner’s Syndrome.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Leeanne Hill, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Dr Phil's story
results.creator_credit: Phil Bergman, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Dr Phil Bergman is a pediatrician and endocrinologist. He was encouraged to become involved with the Victorian Turner’s Syndrome Association and has since become a specialist in the field. Over the years he has contributed greatly to the care of those with Turner’s Syndrome and values support for those with the condition as much as medical advancements in the area.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Phil Bergman, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Dr Phil Bergman is a pediatrician and endocrinologist. He was encouraged to become involved with the Victorian Turner’s Syndrome Association and has since become a specialist in the field. Over the years he has contributed greatly to the care of those with Turner’s Syndrome and values support for those with the condition as much as medical advancements in the area.

results.title: Diary of a backpack
results.creator_credit: Gabrielle Guaran, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Gabrielle Guaran’s backpack tells of all the adventures taken with her owner, a woman with Turner’s Syndrome. Depsite getting old, Guaran hasn’t given up on her backpack, in much the same way she refuses to give up on the life she wants to lead.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gabrielle Guaran, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Gabrielle Guaran’s backpack tells of all the adventures taken with her owner, a woman with Turner’s Syndrome. Depsite getting old, Guaran hasn’t given up on her backpack, in much the same way she refuses to give up on the life she wants to lead.

results.title: Beautiful brown eyes
results.creator_credit: David Facey, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: When David Facey’s daughter was born the first thing he fell in love with was her beautiful brown eyes. Ironically, it was those same eyes that told him something wasn’t quite right.

results.title: Pitcha this : life stories from A.S.H.E (Shepparton) : Digital Storytelling project
results.creator_credit: Natasha Craig, Troy Lovett, Chris Mansfield, Daniel McCrimmon, Brian Beckhurst, Misty Briggs, Joel Atkinson, Tammy-Lee Atkinson, Helen Atkinson, VicHealth, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Nine stories of the lives of students from Shepparton’s A.S.H.E (Academy of Sport, Health and Education), as created by the students as part of ACMI’s Digital Storytelling program. These students, also members of the Indigenous community, tell of their loves, ambitions and, mostly, of the family that support and sustain them.
results.title_for_label: Pitcha this : life stories from A.S.H.E (Shepparton) : Digital Storytelling project
results.creator_credit_for_label: Natasha Craig, Troy Lovett, Chris Mansfield, Daniel McCrimmon, Brian Beckhurst, Misty Briggs, Joel Atkinson, Tammy-Lee Atkinson, Helen Atkinson, VicHealth, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Nine stories of the lives of students from Shepparton’s A.S.H.E (Academy of Sport, Health and Education), as created by the students as part of ACMI’s Digital Storytelling program. These students, also members of the Indigenous community, tell of their loves, ambitions and, mostly, of the family that support and sustain them.

results.title: To my dearest son Mileak
results.creator_credit: Natasha Craig, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Even though Natasha Craig was pregnant at age 15, she was determined to have her child and embrace her new life as a mother. With the support of her family, she has been able to do so and doesn’t regret her decision as she sets up her life for her and her son.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Natasha Craig, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Even though Natasha Craig was pregnant at age 15, she was determined to have her child and embrace her new life as a mother. With the support of her family, she has been able to do so and doesn’t regret her decision as she sets up her life for her and her son.
